medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute severe abdominal pain associated with fever.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began acutely around 3 pm. The patient has a history of alcohol-induced liver cirrhosis, and the symptoms have progressed with the finding of perforated diverticulitis.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Class A liver alcoholic cirrhosis with portal hypertension, caput medusa, esophageal varices; peptic ulcer disease with duodenal perforation status post repair; hypertension; hyperlipidemia; insulin resistance that resolved after weight loss; acute pancreatitis; side branch intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasm; abdominal wall herniation.
medical_history.family_history: His father died of esophageal cancer. His mother is healthy. He has two brothers; one drinks and smokes, the other is healthy.
